page.title: 04TRADE
page.content: Although Atherstone had social and economic difficulties the traditional grain market flourished and helped to supplement their agricultural payment by trading.New trades were thus introduced that had hardly any link to existing ones that were land biased.A thriving wool and cloth trade was being provided by at least two weavers using wool,flax and hemp.It was during the latter years of the 17C that there emerged two felt makers -Thomas Wilday and Joseph Hatton who brought about the basis for the 19C hat trade which has made Atherstone famous.As the quantity and type of trader increased,so was there a need for more comfortable conditions.The old tenements were improved by masons,bricklayers etc that were employed by the now prosperous traders.The annual fair lost its importance and became an entertainment.
